workflowSteps.details: Prior authorization request submitted by Dr. Michael Chen
workflowSteps.outcome: Case PA-2024-002 created and queued for processing
workflowSteps.comments: High priority case - Acute coronary syndrome, high-cost procedure ($15,000)

workflowSteps.details: Collected 5 documents: Prior Auth Form, Patient Medical History, Cardiology Notes, Stress Test Results, Insurance Card
AI-powered OCR and data extraction from all documents
workflowSteps.outcome: Successfully extracted: Patient demographics, Clinical assessment, Diagnosis (ICD-10: I25.10 - NSTEMI), Procedure code (CPT: 93458), Test results, Insurance details

workflowSteps.details: Rules engine evaluation: High-cost procedure ($15,000), Complex cardiac case, Requires clinical review
workflowSteps.outcome: Routed to clinical review panel - Does not meet auto-approval criteria
workflowSteps.comments: High cost threshold exceeded. Clinical complexity requires specialist review.

workflowSteps.outcome: Active coverage confirmed. Deductible: $500 remaining. Coverage limit: None for cardiac procedures
workflowSteps.comments: Patient eligible. No prior denials. Cardiac catheterization covered under PPO plan.

workflowSteps.outcome: Stress Test: POSITIVE for ischemia. EKG: ST depression in multiple leads. Troponin: Elevated (0.8 ng/mL). TIMI Risk Score: 4 (intermediate)
workflowSteps.comments: Strong clinical evidence supporting need for invasive assessment

workflowSteps.details: Evaluated against ACC/AHA guidelines for ACS management
workflowSteps.outcome: Procedure appropriate for NSTEMI with positive stress test. Meets medical necessity criteria per ACC/AHA Class I recommendation.
workflowSteps.comments: Multiple risk factors present: Diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, family history. Symptomatic with chest pain.

workflowSteps.outcome: Panel members: Dr. Sarah Mitchell (Cardiologist), Dr. Michael Chen (Interventional Cardiologist), Dr. Lisa Anderson (Cardiology), Dr. Robert Thompson (Internal Medicine)
workflowSteps.comments: Multidisciplinary review for high-cost cardiac procedure

workflowSteps.outcome: APPROVE - Clear signs of coronary artery disease. Positive stress test, elevated troponin, and ST depression on EKG strongly support need for cardiac catheterization.
workflowSteps.comments: Delay could result in adverse cardiac event. Urgent procedure indicated.

workflowSteps.outcome: APPROVE - Clinical presentation consistent with NSTEMI. TIMI risk score of 4 indicates intermediate risk requiring urgent intervention.
workflowSteps.comments: Cardiac catheterization is gold standard for diagnosis and potential intervention.

workflowSteps.outcome: APPROVE - Multiple risk factors present. Positive stress test result with ST changes. Patient symptomatic with chest pain.
workflowSteps.comments: Procedure indicated per ACC/AHA guidelines. Medical necessity clearly established.

workflowSteps.outcome: APPROVE - Clinical presentation warrants immediate diagnostic workup. Cardiac biomarkers elevated, EKG changes present.
workflowSteps.comments: Risk stratification tools indicate need for invasive assessment. Approve for expedited cardiac catheterization.
Strong consensus based on clinical evidence, guideline compliance, and medical necessity
Approved based on unanimous panel recommendation and strong clinical justification

workflowSteps.details: Generated approval letter with authorization details
workflowSteps.comments: Letter includes: Authorization number, approved procedure, valid dates (14 days - urgent), provider instructions

workflowSteps.details: Urgent notification sent to Dr. Michael Chen at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
workflowSteps.outcome: Email and phone notification delivered successfully
workflowSteps.comments: Provider portal updated immediately due to urgent nature of procedure

workflowSteps.details: Authorization data transmitted to EMR system
workflowSteps.outcome: EMR Patient ID: EMR_8B6E2K19, Order placed successfully
workflowSteps.comments: EMR integration successful. Hospital notified for urgent scheduling. Order ID: ORD_3X7N5R2P9T

keyFindings.clinicalJustification: 52-year-old female with acute coronary syndrome (NSTEMI). Positive stress test showing ischemia, elevated cardiac biomarkers, ST depression on EKG. Multiple cardiac risk factors including diabetes, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia.
keyFindings.medicalNecessity: Cardiac catheterization medically necessary for diagnosis and potential intervention in NSTEMI per ACC/AHA Class I recommendation. Patient at intermediate risk (TIMI score 4) requiring urgent invasive assessment.
keyFindings.policyCompliance: Procedure covered under Aetna PPO Premier plan. No coverage limits for cardiac procedures. Prior authorization requirement met.
keyFindings.costEfficiency: Procedure cost of $15,000 justified by potential to prevent MI, reduce morbidity, and guide appropriate treatment

approvalDetails.reviewType: Clinical Panel Review - Multidisciplinary Cardiology Panel

qualityMetrics.patientSatisfactionImpact: High - Fast approval for urgent cardiac procedure
